p: Phytate is highly concentrated in several food items derived from plants; it represents the major storage form of phosphorus in mature grains and legumes [ 68]. However, in human beings the insufficient endogenous intestinal phytase limits phosphorus utilization [ 69]; phytate also negatively impacts the bioavailability of mineral ions such as Zn 2+, Fe 2+/3+, Ca 2+, Mg 2+, Mn 2+ and Cu 2+ since it is characterized by a strong chelation affinity with cations and is therefore considered an antinutritional factor [ 68].
